name: Corydalis

Skin: Dry, scaly scabs on face of old people

details: Syphilitic affections. Ulcers of mouth and fauces. Cancer cachexia pronounced. Gummata and night-pains. Chronic diseases, with atony. Tongue clean, broad, and full. Tissues flabby, doughy, cold. Gastric catarrh. (HYDRAST.)
dosage: Tincture, twenty drops three times a day.
